arguments.arg: The documentary file or directory to process.
Where to save the output (e.g., `README.md`). If not passed, prints to `stdout`.
Generate documentation in Wiki mode. The value of the argument must be the location of wiki, e.g., `../documentary.wiki`. The `--output` option in this case has no effect.
When generating _Wiki_, this is a list of comma-separated values used to specify which pages to process in current compilation, e.g., `Address` or `Address,DNS`.
Just print the table of contents.
The location of types' files which are not referenced in the documentation (e.g., for printing links to external docs).
Print files in reverse order. Useful for blogs.
Add `h1` headings to the Table of Contents.
Watch files for changes and recompile the documentation.
Disable forks' cache for the run. The new output of forks will be updated in cache so that it can be used next time without `-c` arg.
The root namespace: types within it will not be printed with their namespace prefix.
Starts _Documentary_ in watch mode. After changes are detected, the commit is undone, and new one is made over it, forcing git push.
[Deprecated] Places typedefs definitions into JavaScript files from types.xml. Use `typal` instead.
[Deprecated] Migrates existing typedefs from a JavaScript file into types.xml. Use `typal -m` instead.
